title: How to Remove Icons from the Android Home Screen

steps.title: Understand Android's limitations.
steps.content: Understand Android's limitations. Since different manufacturers implement different menu options for their Androids, your phone (or tablet) might not have the ability to delete app icons from the Home screen.

steps.title: Unlock your Android's screen.
steps.content: Unlock your Android's screen. Press the "Lock" button, then enter your passcode, PIN, or pattern to unlock the screen.

steps.title: Go to a different screen if necessary.
steps.content: Go to a different screen if necessary. If you have multiple Home screen pages, swipe right to scroll through the pages until you arrive at the page on which the icon that you want to remove resides.

steps.title: Find an icon that you want to remove.
steps.content: Find an icon that you want to remove. Keep in mind that the icons on the Home screen are links to the pertaining apps, not apps themselves—removing an app icon will not remove the app from your Android's App Drawer.

steps.title: Try long-pressing an app icon.
steps.content: Try long-pressing an app icon. Some Android developers put a menu option for removing apps in a long-press menu, so tap and hold the app to see if a menu pops up.

steps.title: Select the "Remove" or "Delete" option.
steps.content: Select the "Remove" or "Delete" option. In the menu, look for the appropriate option to remove the app icon; if you see one, tap it to do so.

steps.title: Tap and drag the app up to the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap and drag the app up to the top of the screen. If you don't see a menu pop up when you long-press the app, look for a "Remove", "Delete", or trash can-shaped option at the top of the screen; if you see one, try dragging the app up to the top of the screen and releasing it there. On some Androids, you'll drag the app over to an X and drop it there. Skip this step if there isn't a "Remove", "Delete", trash can, or X option at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Move apps to a different Home screen.
steps.content: Move apps to a different Home screen. If you don't see a "Delete" or "Remove" option anywhere, tap and drag the app icon that you want to hide over to the far-right edge of the screen, hold it there until the screen scrolls over to a different Home page, and drop the app there. This won't remove the app icon from the Home screen layout, but it will hide the app icon from the main Home screen.

steps.title: Unlock your Galaxy's screen.
steps.content: Unlock your Galaxy's screen. Press the "Lock" button, then enter your passcode, PIN, or pattern to unlock the screen.

steps.title: Go to a different screen if necessary.
steps.content: Go to a different screen if necessary. If you have multiple Home screen pages, swipe right to scroll through the pages until you arrive at the page on which the icon that you want to remove resides.

steps.title: Find an icon that you want to remove.
steps.content: Find an icon that you want to remove. Keep in mind that the icons on the Home screen are links to the pertaining apps, not apps themselves—removing an app icon will not remove the app from your Samsung Galaxy's App Drawer.

steps.title: Long-press the icon.
steps.content: Long-press the icon. Tap and hold the icon until a pop-up menu appears.

steps.title: Tap Remove shortcut.
steps.content: Tap Remove shortcut . It's in the pop-up menu. Doing so will delete the app icon from your Galaxy's Home screen.

steps.title: Unlock your Android's screen.
steps.content: Unlock your Android's screen. Press the "Lock" button, then enter your passcode, PIN, or pattern to unlock the screen. If you're using Nova launcher instead of the stock Android launcher, you can remove your Home screen icons in this way.

steps.title: Go to a different screen if necessary.
steps.content: Go to a different screen if necessary. If you have multiple Home screen pages, swipe right to scroll through the pages until you arrive at the page on which the icon that you want to remove resides.

steps.title: Find an icon that you want to remove.
steps.content: Find an icon that you want to remove. Keep in mind that the icons on the Home screen are links to the pertaining apps, not apps themselves—removing an app icon will not remove the app from your Android's App Drawer.

steps.title: Long-press an app's icon.
steps.content: Long-press an app's icon. After a second or so, a pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Long-press the App info icon.
steps.content: Long-press the App info icon. It's in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Remove when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Remove when prompted. This will remove the app from your Android's Home screen.

steps.title: Unlock your Android's screen.
steps.content: Unlock your Android's screen. Press the "Lock" button, then enter your passcode, PIN, or pattern to unlock the screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold your Android's Home screen.
steps.content: Tap and hold your Android's Home screen. A drop-down menu should appear after a few seconds. [1] X Research source If a drop-down menu doesn't appear, try zooming out by pinching your fingers inward on the Home screen to open the Home screen settings. You may skip the next step if you do this. [2] X Research source If you have an Android which uses the Nougat (7.0) operating system, use the Nougat instructions instead.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's an option in the drop-down menu. Doing so will open the Home screen settings page. On some Androids, you'll instead tap Home screen settings or something similar. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Find the "Add icon" option.
steps.content: Find the "Add icon" option. The "Add icon" option's name and location in this menu will vary, so scroll through the menu to find the option. For example, you'll find "Add icon to Home Screen" at the bottom of the menu on many stock Android phones.

steps.title: Tap the green "Add icon" switch .
steps.content: Tap the green "Add icon" switch . It will turn grey or white . After doing so, your newly added apps should no longer automatically appear on the Home screen. For some Androids, you'll have to tap a checkbox instead.

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store. Tap the Google Play Store app icon, which resembles a multicolored triangle on a white background.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This option is in the top-left corner of the screen. A pop-out menu will appear.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings . It's near the bottom of the pop-out menu. Doing so opens the Settings page.

steps.title: Uncheck the "Add icon to Home screen" box.
steps.content: Uncheck the "Add icon to Home screen" box. This option is in the "General" group of settings; unchecking the box will ensure that your Android no longer adds new apps' shortcuts to your Home screen.
